Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.net

Class Dispatcher

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.net.Dispatcher
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Dispatcher extends Object implements Runnable
Thread that handles IO with a client's Socket, spawned by Server. It provides basic IO operations for receiving, sending JsonObject. It can also notify its users about disconnections via a callback.

    • NOOP_CB

      private static final Runnable NOOP_CB

      private Runnable onDisconnect
      Callback called on client disconnection. By default, it doesn't do anything.

    • onReceiveDefault

      public final Consumer<com.google.gson.JsonObject> onReceiveDefault
      The default callback for onReceive. It routes the command to the MatchRegistry instance.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Dispatcher's infinite execution loop. It will read from the socket parsing any JSON it can and pipe it to the message handler until the socket is disconnected.

      If the socket disconnects, the onDisconnect callback is called and then the thread ends. If the read object is not a valid JsonObject, an error message is sent back (see Messages.buildErrorMessage(String)).

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • setOnDisconnect

      public void setOnDisconnect(Runnable callback)
      Sets the onDisconnect callback to the provided Runnable. If null is passed, the default NOOP callback will be assigned.
      Parameters:
      callback - the new callback to use

    • setOnReceive

      public void setOnReceive(Consumer<com.google.gson.JsonObject> callback)
      Sets the onReceive callback to the provided BiConsumer. If null is passed, the default NOOP callback will be assigned.
      Parameters:
      callback - the new callback to use

    • receive

      public Optional<com.google.gson.JsonObject> receive()
      Reads a JSON object from the Socket and parses it into a JsonObject. If everything goes as planned, the parsed object is returned wrapped in an Optional, otherwise an empty one is returned. If the socket disconnects while reading, ClientDisconnectedException is thrown. The method blocks until a full object has been read. The separator used between objects is an empty line.
      Returns:
      an Optional wrapping the parsed JsonObject.
      Throws:
      ClientDisconnectedException - if the Socket disconnects while reading

    • send

      public void send(com.google.gson.JsonObject toWrite)
      Writes to the Socket the JsonObject passed.
      Parameters:
      toWrite - the object to write to the Socket
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if toWrite is null
